DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Child Self-Report Age 13 To 18 Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value of a child's self-reported score on the PedsQL Measurement Model within the thirteen to eighteen years of age category.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Child Self-Report Age 13 To 18 Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (pee-dee-AT-rik) Having to do with children._A generic concept reflecting concern with the modification and enhancement of life attributes, e.g., physical, political, moral and social environment; the overall condition of a human life._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)_A human offspring (son or daughter) of any age; an immediate progeny._An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information._A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth._A number with no fractional part.::13_Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A number with no fractional part.::18

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)

Concepts.definition: A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)

Property.preferredName: Child Self-Report Age Integer::13 To Integer::18 Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A human offspring (son or daughter) of any age; an immediate progeny.:An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation  of an event or information.:A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth.:A number with no fractional part.::13:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A number with no fractional part.::18:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A first-generation, biological descendant of any age.
An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
